problem_text:
For σ ∈ Sn and τ ∈ Sm, where n ⩽ m, let
dflex_n(σ, τ) = (1/n) · (|{x ∈ {1, . . . , n} | σ(x) ̸= τ(x)}| + (m − n)).
An almost-homomorphism {fn} is said to be flexibly close to a homomorphism if there is a sequence of group homomorphisms ρn : G → Smn with n ⩽ mn such that dflex_n(ρn(g), fn(g)) → 0 as n → ∞ for all g ∈ G. The group G is said to be flexibly permutation stable if every almost-homomorphism of G is flexibly close to a homomorphism.
Is SLn(Z) flexibly permutation-stable?
A. Lubotzky
